docs.lead_paragraph: Speakers at a hearing sought the Council’s support for a union campaign for pension payments from owners of six jazz clubs.

headline.main: New York City Council Hears Push for Benefits by Jazz Veterans
headline.print_headline: City Council Hears Push for Benefits by Jazz Veterans

docs.abstract: New York City Council holds hearing on effort by Local 902 of American Federation of Musicians to seek pensions and other benefits for jazz veterans; musician Jimmy Owens unexpectedly plays spiritual Nobody Knows the Trouble I've Seen on his fluegelhorn, during his testimony, to drive point home.
docs.snippet: Speakers at a hearing sought the Council’s support for a union campaign for pension payments from owners of six jazz clubs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hospitals often say acquisitions are necessary to coordinate care, but the Federal Trade Commission says consolidation could increase consumer costs.

headline.main: F.T.C. Wary of Mergers by Hospitals
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Wary of Mergers by Hospitals

docs.abstract: Federal Trade Commission is using Clayton Antitrust Act of 1914 to challenge some hospital mergers and acquisitions and has had remarkable success; FTC suggests consumers may be victimized by trend toward consolidation.
docs.snippet: Hospitals often say acquisitions are necessary to coordinate care, but the Federal Trade Commission says consolidation could increase consumer costs.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Scott Wiener, a member of the Board of Supervisors, takes a daily pill to greatly reduce his risk of contracting H.I.V., and he wants to make it more widely available.

headline.main: San Francisco Official Says He Takes Truvada to Prevent H.I.V., and More Gay Men Should, Too
headline.print_headline: San Francisco Politician Says He’s on Pill to Prevent H.I.V.

docs.abstract: Scott Wiener, member of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, takes daily antiviral pill Truvada to greatly reduce his risk of contracting HIV, and he wants to make it more widely available; San Francisco Public Health Dept reported 359 new HIV infections in the city in 2013; many experts believe taking the pills, a practice known as pre-exposure prophylaxis, or PrEP, can cut down on new infections.
docs.snippet: Scott Wiener, a member of the Board of Supervisors, takes a daily pill to greatly reduce his risk of contracting H.I.V., and he wants to make it more widely available.

docs.lead_paragraph: New rules could reduce the number of men who would be prescribed the medicines, as well as coverage from insurance companies for their use.

headline.main: F.D.A. Panel Backs Limits on Testosterone Drugs
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Panel Backs Limits on Testosterone Drugs

docs.abstract: Expert panel votes for Food and Drug Administration to impose strict new limitations on multibillion-dollar testosterone drug industry; recommends agency tighten labels for medicines so they are not prescribed to men who only have problems related to aging; new rules could reduce coverage from insurance companies for their use.
docs.snippet: New rules could reduce the number of men who would be prescribed the medicines, as well as coverage from insurance companies for their use.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Affordable Care Act marketplaces so far, insurance filings show good news for the federal budget and aggressive shoppers. But people who don’t shop could get stuck with a big bill.

headline.main: With New Health Law, Shopping Around Can Be Crucial
headline.print_headline: With New Health Law, Crucial Choices

docs.abstract: The Upshot; analysis of data from McKinsey Center for US Health System Reform shows that in many places premiums are going up by double-digit percentages within many of the most popular health plans under the Affordable Care Act, while others are being cut, making shopping around crucial.
docs.snippet: In the Affordable Care Act marketplaces so far, insurance filings show good news for the federal budget and aggressive shoppers. But people who don’t shop could get stuck with a big bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: The committee said the health care system was geared toward delivering costly additional care that patients often do not want.

headline.main: Panel Urges Overhauling Health Care at End of Life
headline.print_headline: Panel Urges Overhauling Health Care at End of Life

docs.abstract: National nonpartisan committee appointed by Institute of Medicine concludes country's system for handling end-of-life care is largely broken and should be overhauled at almost every level; calls for sweeping change.
docs.snippet: The committee said the health care system was geared toward delivering costly additional care that patients often do not want.

docs.lead_paragraph: New competition between health insurers offering so-called Obamacare plans in 2015 is having an impact on the pricing of such coverage, based on a first look at proposed insurance premiums, the head of Humana Inc said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Humana CEO: New Competition Curbs Obamacare Plan Prices

docs.snippet: New competition between health insurers offering so-called Obamacare plans in 2015 is having an impact on the pricing of such coverage, based on a first look at proposed insurance premiums, the head of Humana Inc said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Anthem, Hospitals Join to Offer New Insurance Plan
